prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Is Stefan happily married to Suzanne, what is the true nature of his feelings towards his wife and marriage?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical list of the horary chart data—as determined strictly by horary principles—that you will need for further interpretation. I have organized the information according to key components relevant to the query. In your question Stefan is indicated by the 9th house and you (Melissa) by the Ascendant.

1. Chart Setup & Key Data
 • Date/Time/Location: February 3, 2025, 2:29 PM; South Lyon, Michigan
 • Chart Type: Horary

2. House Cusps & Representations
 • Ascendant (Melissa’s Significator): 5° Cancer (1st House), containing Mars
 • 9th House (Stefan’s area as designated by your instructions): Begins at 17° Aquarius
  – Note: In horary, the condition of the cusp and any planets that might fall into or aspect the 9th house inform Stefan’s state
 • House Cross-Reference: (Using your provided guide, note that Stefan’s significations are read through the 9th house and its ruler)

3. Key Planetary Placements (with respect to the provided houses)
 • 8th House (starts at 28° Capricorn; spans into Aquarius up to 17° Aquarius):
  – Sun at 15° 13′ Aquarius
  – Mercury at 11° 6′ Aquarius
  – Pluto at 2° 8′ Aquarius
 • 10th House (starts at 11° Pisces):
  – Venus at 29° 36′ Pisces
  – Saturn at 17° 43′ Pisces
  – Neptune at 28° 2′ Pisces
  – North Node at 29° 42′ Pisces
 • 11th House (starts at 17° Aries):
  – Moon at 25° 12′ Aries
  – Uranus at 23° 16′ Taurus
  – Chiron at 19° 35′ Aries
 • 12th House (starts at 2° Gemini):
  – Jupiter at 11° 16′ Gemini

4. Aspect Patterns and Major Aspects
 • T-Square Pattern noted:
  – Involves MC at 11° Pisces, Jupiter at 11° Gemini, IC at 11° Virgo, and Saturn at 17° Pisces
 • Listed Major Aspects (with orbs noted):
  – Jupiter square IC (orb: 0°)
  – Jupiter square MC (orb: 0°)
  – MC opposite IC (orb: 0°)
  – Venus conjunct North Node (orb: 0°)
  – Mercury trine Jupiter (orb: 0°)
  – Neptune conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
  – Venus conjunct Neptune (orb: 1°)
  – Mars square Chiron (orb: 0°)
  – Mars trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
  – Pluto sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
  – Venus sextile Pluto (orb: 3°)
  – Mars sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
  – Sun sextile Chiron (orb: 4°)
  – Sun conjunct Mercury (orb: 4°)
  – Sun trine Jupiter (orb: 4°)
  – Uranus sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
  – Ascendant sextile IC (orb: 6°)
  – Saturn sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
  – Venus sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
  – Jupiter square Saturn (orb: 6°)
  – Venus square Ascendant (orb: 6°)
  – Moon square Mars (orb: 6°)
  – Saturn opposite IC (orb: 6°)
  – Saturn conjunct MC (orb: 6°)
  – Moon conjunct Chiron (orb: 6°)
  – Ascendant trine MC (orb: 6°)
  – Neptune square Ascendant (orb: 7°)
  – Moon square Pluto (orb: 7°)
  – Mars trine MC (orb: 8°)

5. Additional Observations & Notable Patterns
 • Dominance of the Water element among the inner planets
 • Distribution of the three modes (Cardinal, Mutable, Fixed) is even
 • The chart exhibits a “Bowl” shape with the majority of planets in the top right quadrant, while the bottom right quadrant is empty
 • The moon (in Aries) and Mars (in Cancer) are in mutual reception by sign affinity
 • Neptune is placed in its sign of rulership (Pisces) which is worth noting when evaluating its potential influence on the marriage query

6. Specific Horary Points for the Marriage Query
 • Querent’s (Melissa’s) condition: Indicated by Ascendant (5° Cancer) and its ruler
 • Stefan’s condition: Indicated by the 9th House cusp (17° Aquarius) and the condition of its traditional ruler (Saturn, residing at 17° Pisces in the 10th House)
  – The sign on the cusp (Aquarius) affects how Stefan’s status and feelings are read, and any aspects to the 9th cusp or its ruler will bear upon the answer regarding his marital state

Based on the listed data above, you now have a complete inventory of the horary chart’s critical factors for a further, evidence-driven interpretation of Stefan’s feelings and the nature of his marriage with Suzanne.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Analyzing the chart under the strict guidelines of horary principles, here is the interpretation regarding Stefan’s state and the nature of his feelings toward his marriage to Suzanne:

1. Stefan’s Significator and House Placement
• Stefan is represented by the 9th house, which begins at 17° Aquarius. Under traditional rules, the planet that rules Aquarius is Saturn. In this chart, Saturn is placed at 17° Pisces in the 10th house. This placement suggests that, while outward duty and public responsibilities (the realm of the 10th house) are clearly in focus, there is an underlying tension subdued under a veneer of social obligation. Saturn’s position in Pisces lacks the grounding dignity it enjoys in Capricorn or Aquarius; this weakness can signal internal struggles and uncertainty when it comes to personal commitments.

2. The T-Square and Conflict Dynamics
• A T-square involving the Midheaven (MC at 11° Pisces), Jupiter (11° Gemini), and the Imum Coeli (IC at 11° Virgo), along with Saturn positioned on the MC, creates a pattern of conflict between ideals, public image, and inner security. Jupiter’s square to both the IC and MC indicates that expansive or idealistic views are at odds with the more concrete demands of home and public recognition. In Stefan’s case, this suggests that his marriage might be caught between societal expectations and his own search for deeper meaning. There is an element of overextension or inner conflict that casts doubt on the warmth or contentment of his marital feelings.

3. Emotional and Psychological Factors
• The Moon, positioned at 25° Aries in the 11th house, represents Stefan’s emotional nature as seen by the associations of the 11th house with friendships and aspirations. However, the Moon’s square to Mars (orb 6°) and square to Pluto (orb 7°) hints at an intensity of emotion that could manifest as internal unrest or even subtle power struggles. This aspect suggests an undercurrent of irritability, impulsiveness, or suppressed dissatisfaction that might not be immediately apparent in his public behavior.
• Further, Mars in Cancer on the Ascendant (representing Melissa’s significations) in mutual reception with the Moon indicates that while there is a dynamic emotional interplay, there is also the element of conditions that provoke impulsivity. This interplay can accentuate inner turmoil for Stefan regarding his commitment.

4. Idealism Versus Reality in the 10th House Cluster
• The cluster in the 10th house—Venus at 29° Pisces, Neptune at 28° Pisces, and the North Node at 29° Pisces—adds an element of dreaminess, idealization, and sometimes blurred boundaries regarding matters of love and commitment. Although such placements can imbue a romantic or transcendent quality to the relationship, the practical weight carried by Saturn suggests that idealism struggles against the burden of duty and realism. Here, the very qualities of empathy and idealism that these placements bring are tempered by the turning of responsibility, indicating that while there might be moments of emotional tenderness, they are frequently overwhelmed by a sense of obligation rather than passionate fulfillment.

5. Synthesis and Implications for Stefan’s Marriage
• The condition of Saturn—the significator for Stefan—shows a state of restrained capability, burdened by responsibilities rather than the unbridled warmth of happy contentment.
• The conflicting aspects (Jupiter square Saturn, T-square involving key angles, and the Moon’s intense aspects) point toward internal divisions, where duty and social expectation maintain the marriage’s public façade, while a simmering internal conflict exists regarding his emotional satisfaction.
• Overall, the chart indicates that Stefan’s marriage to Suzanne, while maintained with an air of public duty, is not built on unequivocal happy contentment. His feelings appear to be marked by a sense of obligation, inner conflict, and moments of idealistic yearning that fail to resolve the tension between what is expected and his internal state.

Based on these specific elements in your horary chart, the indication is that while Stefan outwardly upholds his marital duties, internally his emotions are conflicted. His sense of duty, influenced by a challenging Saturn, seems to conflict with deeper idealistic or rebellious impulses as suggested by the T-square and the intense aspects involving the Moon and Mars. This leads to the reading that his feelings, though not overtly negative, are marked by a persistent undercurrent of discontent and internal conflict rather than genuine emotional fulfillment.

• The cluster in the 10th house—Venus at 29° Pisces, Neptune at 28° Pisces, and the North Node at 29° Pisces—adds an element of dreaminess, idealization, and sometimes blurred boundaries regarding matters of love and commitment. Although such placements can imbue a romantic or transcendent quality to the relationship, the practical weight carried by Saturn suggests that idealism struggles against the burden of duty and realism. Here, the very qualities of empathy and idealism that these placements bring are tempered by the turning of responsibility, indicating that while there might be moments of emotional tenderness, they are frequently overwhelmed by a sense of obligation rather than passionate fulfillment.

5. Synthesis and Implications for Stefan’s Marriage
• The condition of Saturn—the significator for Stefan—shows a state of restrained capability, burdened by responsibilities rather than the unbridled warmth of happy contentment.
• The conflicting aspects (Jupiter square Saturn, T-square involving key angles, and the Moon’s intense aspects) point toward internal divisions, where duty and social expectation maintain the marriage’s public façade, while a simmering internal conflict exists regarding his emotional satisfaction.
• Overall, the chart indicates that Stefan’s marriage to Suzanne, while maintained with an air of public duty, is not built on unequivocal happy contentment. His feelings appear to be marked by a sense of obligation, inner conflict, and moments of idealistic yearning that fail to resolve the tension between what is expected and his internal state.

Based on these specific elements in your horary chart, the indication is that while Stefan outwardly upholds his marital duties, internally his emotions are conflicted. His sense of duty, influenced by a challenging Saturn, seems to conflict with deeper idealistic or rebellious impulses as suggested by the T-square and the intense aspects involving the Moon and Mars. This leads to the reading that his feelings, though not overtly negative, are marked by a persistent undercurrent of discontent and internal conflict rather than genuine emotional fulfillment.
